Photography

I'm currently rocking a K-5 with the kit 18-55mm and a 50mm prime that is legacy glass, 100% manual all the way from the focus to the aperture. My alternate is an old minolta film camera, which I love to use but only on occasion as film and development costs are high. I've been taking pictures for the last 2 or 3 years, and incorporated it into an elective course this past year. It has served as an excellent way to both document my travels and provide a creative outlet during the semester.

I've volunteered this skill with Beat Auburn Beat Hunger, a student-led volunteer organization on campus and taken a senior portraits during graduation season. However, most of my photography is for personal enjoyment and sharing on instagram and flickr.
